commitResults.messageBody: This reverts commit f548fbfb019cec680575d4b14f2a7d000f5ca73e.

commitResults.messageTitle: add method to add different task to list
Adjust coding style to meet course coding standards

commitResults.messageBody:
The program may crashes when encountering corrupt data while reading the text file.

Let's add DudeCorruptedDataException class to handle corrupt data during file reads.

Using exception in this case ensure the program can continue operating instead of failing.

The program lacks the ability to save task, resulting in data loss when the exiting program.

Data need to be persisted and able to restore when user restarts the program.

Let's add a saving system to store user data in a text file.

Text file is used to store the data for easy access.

commitResults.messageTitle: fix: remove redundant try-catch in exit() method
commitResults.messageBody:
There is a try-catch block in exit() method which handle exception throw
by saveData() method.

The saveData() method is being refined and no longer throw any
exception, DudeDataFileException class is also deleted, these cause
the try-catch block in exit() method become redundant and cause
compilation error.

Let's remove the try-catch block for saveData() method in exit() method.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: add dates and times check
commitResults.messageBody:
Users are able to input anything as date and time while creating a
new task.

Program able to recognize valid date and time is more user-friendly
as it helps user to create tasks with valid and correct details.

Let's,
* define a date and time format for user input
* update addDeadline() and addEvent() methods to check for valid
date and time
* add a new exception named DudeDateTimeFormatException to
deal with invalid date and time input

Using a fixed format for input enable the program to recognise valid
input easily and the new exception is used to inform user on the
format error and show user the correct format.

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor: change DudeCorruptedDataException and DudeNullDateTimeException message
commitResults.messageBody: Exceptions' message change to make it more clear and precise.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: add validation to ensure 'from' date is before 'to' date
commitResults.messageBody:
Users are able to input any date and time for 'from' and 'to' when creating an event as long as the format is correct.

The program allows users to create an event with invalid time range.

Let's implement a check to validate that the 'from' date is earlier than the 'to' date.

The application does not have an enumeration to represent the different
types of commands that can be issued.

Without an enumeration, command handling is less organized and
make code more difficult to understand.

Let's add an enum named CommandType to represent the different
types of commands.

Using an enum ensures that all command types are centrally defined,
making the code more maintainable and easier to understand.

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor: Extract functionalities from Dude.java into seperate classes
commitResults.messageBody:
Several functionalities are packed in Dude class such as user
interaction, file handling, command parsing and task management.

This tight coupling makes the code difficult to maintain and
understand, which can lead to potential issues in future development.

Let's extract related functionalities into separate classes such
as Ui, Storage, Parser, and TaskList.

This enhances code readability, maintainability and also adhering to
the Single Responsibility Principle.

commitResults.messageTitle: docs: Add Javadoc for classes and methods
commitResults.messageBody:
There is no Javadoc for many classes.

Without proper documentation, the code is difficult to understand and maintain,
especially for new developers or contributors.

Let's add Javadoc comments to all classes and methods.

Clear Javadoc improves code readability and aids future development.

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor: Put Task related classes into package dude.task
fix: Set up Gradle to run with correct class name
test: Add JUnit test to few classes
commitResults.messageBody:
The project currently lacks automated testing.

Adding automated tests ensures the correctness of the code.

Let's add JUnit tests for few classes such as Parser, TaskList and Deadline.

commitResults.messageTitle: fix: Set up Gradle to create JAR file
ci: Set up Gradle to use checkstyle
refactor: Adjust coding style to meet course coding standards

commitResults.messageBody:
Current system lacks a way to search for tasks by a specific keyword.

Search function can enhance user experience and make task management more efficient.

Let's add a find command to search and filter tasks based on a given keyword.

commitResults.messageTitle: test: Add test cases to test findAllTask method in TaskList
fix: Update find method to handle empty task descriptions
commitResults.messageBody:
Find command will react as no match found when no searching
keyword is provided.

Having a different message for no description and no search result
for find command enchance user experience because users are
able to see the problem clearly.

Let's update find method to throw DudeNullDescriptionException
when no description is provided.

The application currently operates through Text UI, which limits its
user experience.

GUI can enhance user experience by making the application more
visually appealing and user-friendly.

Let's implement a GUI for Dude.java.

Using JavaFX to create a GUI allows for seamless integration with
the existing codebase.

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor: Put GUI related classes into package dude.gui
fix: Fix application unable to close after "bye" command
commitResults.messageBody:
The application remains open after using the 'bye' command due to the
lack of proper shutdown logic in the GUI.

Users expect the application to close when they use the "bye" command,
the lack of this functionality could causes confusion and a poor user
experience.

Let's,
* add a method in Dude to check if it is running
* add method in MainWindow to close the application after a short delay if
Dude is no longer running

The short delay ensures that application display the exit message before
the it exits.

commitResults.messageTitle: test: Correcting testcases for ParserTest and TaskListTest
refactor: Add assertions to ensure internal logic consistency
commitResults.messageBody:
No assertion used in any class.

Assertions are important to catch bugs during development and ensure
application runs as expected.

Let's,
* add assertion to check that file path is not empty
* add assertion to check status of Dude after running each method

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor: Restructure some methods in Dude.java
commitResults.messageBody:
Some redundant else statement is used in several methods.

Removing extra else statement make the code more neat and
increase the code readability.

Let's remove redundant else statement in Dude.java methods.

Instead of using a full if-else statement, guard clauses are
implemented to make the happy path clear and increase the
code readability.

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor: Add stream to filter tasks

commitResults.messageBody: refactor: Add assertions to ensure internal logic consistency

* 'master' of https://github.com/MingYiAw/ip:
  refactor: Add assertions to ensure internal logic consistency
refactor: Restructure some methods in Dude.java
refactor: Add stream to filter tasks

commitResults.messageTitle: fix: Fix some merging bug in Dude.java
style: Remove unuse import in TaskList.java
feat: Add user define shortcut for commands
commitResults.messageBody:
Users need to type full commands for Dude to understand.

Typing out full commands is time consuming and affects user efficiency,
this violates the feature of the application for being fast to use.

Let's,
* Add command to define custom shortcuts for each commands
* Add command to remove previously defined shortcuts

Custom shortcuts reduce typing effort and streamline the user's workflow,
offering a better user experience.

commitResults.messageTitle: docs: Add and update Javadoc for user define shortcut update
docs: Update defineShortcut() Javadoc to follow standard style
refactor: Add assertions for define() and undefine()
style: Update ParserTest to follow coding standard

commitResults.messageBody:
Current GUI has a standard font and text size, and lacks visual
feedback for errors.

Improving these aspects enhance user experience and provide
clearer visual cues for errors.

Let's,
* Change the font style
* Increase the font size
* Crop profile picture into circle
* Make profile picture glows in red when displaying error
message
* Display error message in red color and bolded

Improving error display on both profile picture and text
enhance error visibility.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: Rewrite few reply of Dude
commitResults.messageBody:
Dude's messages are bland and boring.

Changing Dude's reply into something more interesting can
enchance user experience.

Let's modify Dude's phrases according to a personality.

Adding personality to Dude improve the quality of the application
and enchance user experience.

Dude's error messages doesn't match the personality of Dude which is
decided earlier.

Rephrasing Dude's error messages to match its other messages
shows the completeness of the application.

Let's modify Dude's error messages according to its personality.

commitResults.messageTitle: style: Refine methods to follow coding standard

commitResults.messageBody:
Users can add task with description that contains characters
that leads to data corruption.

The occurence of data corruption diminish user experience and
reduce the usefulness of the application.

Let's add DudeInvalidNameException to deal with invalid task
name.

Using exception to deal with this issue can prevents data
corruption and inform the user about it.

commitResults.messageTitle: test: Rewrite and add testcases for multiple class
commitResults.messageBody:
There are test cases available for only three classes, and most are
outdated due to recent updates.

The existing tests do not reflect the latest code changes, which may
lead to incomplete or inaccurate testing coverage.

Let's,
* Add new test cases for ToDo.java and Event.java
* Rewrite outdated test cases to align with recent updates

Ensuring the tests are up-to-date and comprehensive improves
overall code quality and reliability.

commitResults.messageTitle: docs: Rewrite and add Javadoc for multiple classes
commitResults.messageBody:
Few classes are missing proper Javadoc or had outdated Javadoc.

Lack of proper Javadoc makes the code harder to understand and
to maintain.

Let's,
* Rewrite outdated Javadoc for few methods in Dude.java
* Add Javadoc for new classes and methods

This was done to improve code readability and maintainability,
making the code more accessible to other developers.

Current application lacks proper documentation for users.

Lack of user guide will cause confusion and greatly diminish user
experience.

Let's add a user guide as README.md

This guide is structured to help users quickly understand how to
interact with the application, improving overall user experience.
